data.title: Code no longer opens directories via cmd/PowerShell or Explorer in a Onedrive Directory
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16226
- Using Windows 10 Pro Insider on the Fast ring, build 16226
- Using OneDrive Files on Demand update as per https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2017/06/13/onedrive-files-demand-now-available-windows-insiders/ 
- OneDrive Version - 17.3.6931.0609
- Only occurs in a OneDrive folder, within other folders it still functions as expected - leads me to think this is a OneDrive & not a VSCode issue, though could be a mix of both

---
Steps to Reproduce Error:

1. Open Explorer to a folder in local OneDrive location for example, ```C:\Users\Ryan\Onedrive\Github\kilasuit\VScodeDirTest\```
1a. Right click to bring up the ```Open with Code``` option and click it
1b. Open PowerShell in the same directory, or navigate to the same directory, and run ```code .\ ``` to open up in the directory 
2. Code opens a new file with the folder name, with no extension, not the folder, as a expected. 

---
Steps to Reproduce Normal Behaviour:

1. Open Explorer to a folder for example, ```C:\temp\VSCodeTestDir\```
1a. Right click to bring up the ```Open with Code``` option and click it
1b. Open PowerShell in the same directory, or navigate to the same directory, and run ```code .\ ``` to open up in the directory 
2. Code opens the folder, as expected, and lists all files within the directory

---

This behaviour has only just recently come about since updating OneDrive as per the article mentioned above so I believe that it's most likely due to the update to OneDrive more than it being a Code issue.

data.title: VS Code and Git Sync Issues.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.4|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|scaffs-vscode|itslennysfault|1.4.4|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.10.1|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.7.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code with a project/solution/folder.
2. The code is synced with repo.
3. Any changes to file does not show in "Source Control"
4. If changes are displayed, one of the following wont work
    - Discard Changes 
    - Stage Changes
   - Working Tree for a file is not displayed.
5. Switching branches is not displayed. Still shows the previous branch.

 All the above issues are consistent. On restart of VS Code, it solves these issues for a moment before it surfaces again.

And the father of all issues, the intellisense does not work in any of the typescript files. In gives the Loading dialogue but does not load anything

data.title: Search in multiroot workspaces
data.body:
- [x] Windows - @isidorn 
- [x] Linux - @Tyriar 
- [x] Mac - @sandy081 

Complexity 3

This impacts
- Search
- Non-ripgrep search (`"search.useRipgrep": false`)
- Quickopen

Please verify that in single and multi-root workspaces, 

- Search shows the correct results from all folders, with `files.exclude` and `search.exclude` settings correctly applied according to global settings, per-folder settings, "files to include/exclude" input boxes, and .gitignore files
- The "find in folder" context menu in the files explorer sets up a search that only returns results from the selected folder
- Quickopen respects the `files.exclude` settings and shows results from all folders

- [x] Windows - @bpasero
- [x] Linux - @chrisdias  
- [x] Mac - @weinand 

Complexity 2.

- Install the GitHub extension: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.github-issues-prs
- Check it uses the Git credentials manager from the Git repository in the opened folder to show the issues for the two upcoming milestones assigned to you.
- If your username cannot be determined through the Git credentials manager, everyones issues will be shown.
- If there are no milestones, all issues are shown (max. 100).
- Use `github.username` setting to show other user's issues / work around Git credentials manager not having your actual username.
- Test with a private repository.

data.title: Clean up multiroot exclude glob handling
data.body:
From #29164

We need to have a centralized place where exclude globs are resolved in a multiroot-aware fashion. Right now this is done differently in different places because the scenarios have different needs, are running in different processes, etc and I couldn't decide how to organize it in June.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/search/node/ripgrepTextSearch.ts#L383

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/search/node/fileSearch.ts#L91

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.ts#L120

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No -- was not able to get a repro.

data.title: Go to declaration change of behavior for mouse events.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I seen lot of discussion about the desire to customize mouse events, few of them create conflicts between the platforms.  My goal is to find references very quickly, yes Shift + F12 works but I would love to be able to use it from the mouse. Being able to fully customize mouse events like keyboard shortcuts would be handy but probably not happening soon.

So my proposal is to change the "go to declaration behavior", everywhere it should work as expected but in case you do Ctrl + click on the declaration itself it could change mode and would do equivalent of Shift + F12. This way all references would go to declaration and declaration would show all used references with one Ctrl + Left click event. I don't really see the need to be able to go to the declaration when you are clicking on the declaration itself. 

And I think doing the declaration peek on mouse over on the declaration itself is bit redundant as well. This could stay as it is so it's not confusing users, be disabled because there is no need for the declaration peek on the declaration itself, or be used for hover information about references? The hover information is not as essential, just wanted to point it out when I'm at it. But the click mouse event change would be improvement to the UI.

data.title: Test Plan for Emmet 2.0
data.body:
Test plan for #21943

Complexity: 3.5
- [x] Linux - @Tyriar 
- [x] Windows - @gregvanl 

Set `emmet.useNewEmmet` to `true` and test the below emmet commands
- Increment/Decrement by 0.1/1/10.
    - https://docs.emmet.io/actions/inc-dec-number/. 
    - Should work in any file regardless of language mode
- Evaluate Math Expression. 
    - https://docs.emmet.io/actions/evaluate-math/. 
    - Should work in any file regardless of language mode
- Emmet: Expand Abbreviation. 
    - [Emmet Cheetsheet](https://docs.emmet.io/cheat-sheet/)
    - Set `editor.quicksuggestions` to `false` so that you don't end up testing the emmet suggestions
    - Test both by selecting the abbreviation and by keeping the cursor at the end of the abbreviation
    - Should expand html abbreviations in 'html', 'xml', 'xsl', 'jsx', 'pug', 'slim'
    - Should expand css abbreviations in 'css', 'sass', 'scss', 'less', 'sss', 'stylus'
    - Set `emmet.syntaxProfiles` to {"anylanguageyouwant" : "anylanguagelistedabove"} to test emmet abbreviations in any of the languages NOT specified above
    - Invalid abbreviations should be ignored
- Emmet: Toggle Comment
    - https://docs.emmet.io/actions/toggle-comment/
    - Test both with selected text (spanning partial line and multiple lines) and empty selection
    - Test both html and css/less/scss files
- Customizing output profile
    - Follow https://docs.emmet.io/customization/syntax-profiles/ to set `emmet.syntaxProfiles` and then test the command `Emmet: Expand Abbreviation` and `Emmet: Wrap with Abbreviation`
- Customizing variables
    - Change the language in `emmet.variables` and test abbreviations like `!` or `html:5` reflect the change in the language
- Set `emmet.excludeLanguages` to any of the languages listed way above and check that the `Emmet: Expand Abbreviation` command does nothing
- Set `emmet.quickSuggestions` to `true` and test emmet abbreviations in the suggestion list in any of  'html', 'xml', 'xsl', 'jsx', 'pug', 'slim', 'css', 'sass', 'scss', 'less', 'sss', 'stylus'
 - Test `Emmet: Select Next/Prev Item`
     - https://docs.emmet.io/actions/select-item/
     - Run the command multiple consecutive times to traverse the file
     - Test in both html and css files.
     - Test both single and multi cursor

data.title: Test diff review panel accessibility
data.body:
Test plan item for #17263

 - [x] NVDA on Windows - @michelkaporin 
 - [x] VoiceOver on OSX - @rebornix 

When in a diff editor, it is now possible to use F7 and Shift+F7 to navigate and review diffs.

Please check:
* the diff review panel gets focus when invoked.
* the diff review panel will merge adjacent diffs (within 3 lines)
* it is possible to use arrow keys to navigate between lines.
* the messages presented to Screen Readers make sense and allow for deciphering a diff.
* it is possible to go to a line by pressing Enter
* it is possible to dismiss the diff review panel via Escape

data.title: Test: Auto Indent when paste content
data.body:
Testing Paste part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28658

Complexity 2:

- [x] any OS - @michelkaporin 
- [x] any OS - @ramya-rao-a 

This feature is implemented by checking indentation rules. It means if there is no indentation rules for the language you are using, then it will not take effect.

It's similar to indentation adjustment in moving lines. A typical use case, copying several lines of content, pasting it to a block whose indentation is different from the copying part, after pasting the indentation of pasted area should adjust the indentation.

Please note that if you have `editor.formatOnPaste` turned on, this feature will not kick in. You'd better turn that off and then test.

data.title: Test: Auto Indent when Type
data.body:
Testing Type part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28658

Complexity 3:

- [x] any OS - @chrmarti   
- [x] any OS - @chrisdias 

This feature is implemented by checking indentation rules. It means if there is no indentation rules for the language you are using, then it will not take effect.

A typical use case is writing brackets in TS/JS or `def/end` in Ruby scripts. The indentation should adjust immediately after you type the character.

data.title: Test: Auto Indent on moving lines
data.body:
Testing Move Lines part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28658

Complexity 2:

- [x] Linux - @Tyriar 
- [x] any OS - @egamma 
- [x] mac - @jrieken

This feature is implemented by checking indentation rules. It means if there is no indentation rules for the language you are using, then it will not take effect.

A typical use case is moving content into a block and the moving text gets shifted. Please test against cases you think should be reasonable.

data.title: Test: introduce "DidTerminateDebugSession" event
Why is VSCode uploading every HTTP request to Microsoft servers?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Linux x64

Having noted a lot of entries in my firewall log, it seems that every `http.get()` executed in my extension results in the full URL being uploaded to Microsoft via ApplicationInsights.

This happens, **even when all extensions are disabled, the following Telemetry options turned off in Settings and VSCode restarted**:
```
"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false,
"telemetry.enableCrashReporter": false
```

Example code:
```
const http = require('http');
http.get('http://127.0.0.1/some/path?with=data', r => {});
```
Results in the following ApplicationInsights log file being created in `/tmp/appInsights-node/` (shortened for brevity)

```
{"ver":1,"name":"Microsoft.ApplicationInsights....RemoteDependency","time":"2017-06-26T19:03:13.374Z","sampleRate":100,"tags":{"ai.application.ver":"0.0.1","ai.device.id":"","ai.cloud.roleInstance":"**my_machine_name**","ai.device.osVersion":"**my_os_version**","ai.device.osArchitecture":"x64","ai.device.osPlatform":"linux","ai.internal.sdkVersion":"node:0.18.0","undefined":""},"data":{"baseType":"Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.RemoteDependencyData","baseData":{"ver":2,"success":true,"properties":{},"measurements":{},"type":"Http","target":"127.0.0.1","name":"GET /some/path","data":"**http ://127.0.0.1/some/path?with=data**", "duration":"00:00:00.168","resultCode":"200"}},"appVer":"0.0.1","iKey":"AIF-...","os":"Linux","osVer":"my_os_version","seq":"..."}
```

As you can see highlighted in bold, the full URL and data is included along with my machine name (the resolved 127.0.0.1 IP).
All of this appears to be uploaded to **vortex.data.microsoft.com**

Can you explain why Microsoft needs to log every single http request and how to turn this off?
